docs.snippet: THE recent revolt of members of the National Socialist party, or Naziinclined extremists, in Santiago, Chile, along with the bold efforts of Hitler and Mussolini to popularize their fascist or totalitarian ideas among the socalled Latin peoples in...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE recent revolt of members of the National Socialist party, or Naziinclined extremists, in Santiago, Chile, along with the bold efforts of Hitler and Mussolini to popularize their fascist or totalitarian ideas among the socalled Latin peoples in the southern half of the New World, has not only aroused in us a growing concern about foreign influences among our neighbors but has quickened our interest in the vast continent next door.

docs.snippet: President Roosevelt today proclaimed the Inter-American Radio Communications Convention, signed at Havana last Dec. 13 by the United States and fourteen other American countries. Signers included Brazil, Canada, Colombia, Cuba, Chile, Dominican...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Roosevelt today proclaimed the Inter-American Radio Communications Convention, signed at Havana last Dec. 13 by the United States and fourteen other American countries. Signers included Brazil, Canada, Colombia, Cuba, Chile, Dominican Republic, Guatemala, Haiti, Mexico, Nicaragua, Panama, Peru, Uruguay and Venezuela.
